channel.title: Problem in "waveshaper" tutorial?
channel.description: Hello, In the factory tutorial 15_waveshaper, the table is read with interpolation. It seems to me that the interpolation between the last and the first value of the table is here not desirable. This results in the highest value in the incoming signal to be output as the lowest point. Not so soft a saturation: Do I miss something, or would that be a nice option to have a kind of "read/table interp noloop" factory object? Thanks.

item.title: Problem in "waveshaper" tutorial?
item.dc:creator: @jfcharles Jean-Francois Charles
item.description:
@jfcharles wrote:

Hello,
In the factory tutorial 15_waveshaper, the table is read with interpolation. It seems to me that the interpolation between the last and the first value of the table is here not desirable. This results in the highest value in the incoming signal to be output as the lowest point. Not so soft a saturation:

Screen Shot 2017-10-18 at 2.53.39 PM.png1176x934 108 KB

Do I miss something, or would that be a nice option to have a kind of "read/table interp noloop" factory object?
Thanks.

Read full topic
